alert.note: Alert for Northern Jasper; Northern Newton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued January 01 at 2:55AM CST until January 02 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, southwest winds 5 to 15 mph with gusts up to 35 mph expected. For the first Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 32 possible. For the second Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 27 possible. * WHERE...Northern Jasper and Northern Newton Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, from 6 AM this morning to 6 PM CST this evening. For the first Freeze Watch, from late tonight through Sunday morning. For the second Freeze Watch, from late Sunday night through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
